subject: Re: [junit] testing switch statements in method
msgSnippet: ... I don t mind at all. It s a reminder that there is a trade-off. It s a shame that the community at large still undervalues the testing side of that
messageBody:
Robert Lucente wrote:

> "if it "cannot" change, then I guess the people involved don't think it very
> important to test it."
>
> Thanks for the words. I hope you don't mind if I use almost the same exact
> words in some other similar situations.

I don't mind at all. It's a reminder that there is a trade-off. It's a
shame that the community at large still undervalues the testing side of
that trade-off. (Of course, that's just my opinion.)
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
